                         AGREEMENT FOR REGULATION OF
                       MOTOR VEHICLE TRAFFIC AND PARKING
                           AT CARUSO MIDDLE SCHOOL

       THIS AGREEMENTis made and entered into this             day of                 ,2013, by
and between the VILLAGE OF DEERFIELD, an Illinois municipal corporation (hereinafter
the "Village"), and the BOARD OF EDUCATION OF DEERFIELD SCHOOL DISTRICT
NO. 109, Lake County, Illinois (hereinafter referred to as "School District"), as the owner of
Caruso Middle School.

                                          RECITALS

        WHEREAS, School District is the owner of a school commonly known as Caruso Middle
School (''School"), including the parking areas associated therewith, which is located within the
limits of the Village of Deerfield and is legally described on Exhibit A attached hereto; and,

        WHEREAS, School District represents and warrants that it has the legal right, title and
authority to control, operate, manage and maintain the School and the parking areas associated
therewith and to enter into this agreement; and,

        WHEREAS, School District desires to enter into an agreement with the Village in order
to empower the Village to regulate the parking of motor vehicles and motor vehicle traffic within
the parking areas associated with the School, and to enforce motor vehicle parking and traffic
regulations with the parking areas associated with the School pursuant to the provisions of
Section 11-209 of the Illinois Motor Vehicle Code (625 ILCS 5/11-209) and of the Municipal
Code ofthe Village of Deerfield;

       .NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants, promises, terms and
conditions contained herein, the parties hereto agree as follows:




                                              -1-
        Section 1: Incorporation of Recitals. The above and foregoing recitals, being material
to this Agreement, are hereby inc~rporated and made a part hereto by this reference.

        Section 2: Traffic Regulations. That the Village is hereby authorized and directed to
establish and enforce motor vehicle parking and traffic control regulations within the parking
areas associated with the School, including :

       A.     The prohibition, regulation, restriction or limitation of the stopping, standing or
       parking of vehicles in specified portions ofthe school parking areas.

       B.      The designation of fire lanes in the school parking areas (meaning travel lanes for
       firefighting equipment upon which there shall be no standing or parking of any motor
       vehicles at any time so that firefighting equipment can move freely thereon).

       C.     The enforcement of persons with disabilities parking areas where appropriate
       above-ground signs have been posted in compliance with state law.

       D.      The enforcement of stop signs and other traffic control signs that may be located
       in the school parking areas.

       E.      The establishment and regulation of loading zones with the consent of the School
       District.

       F.     The prohibition or regulation of the turning of vehicles or specified types of
       vehicles at intersections or other designated locations in the parking areas.

       G.     The designation of any separate roadway in the parking areas for one-way traffic
       only with the consent of the School District.

       H.      The regulation of a crossing of any roadway m the school parking areas by
       pedestrians.

       I.      The erection of stop signs, flashing signals, yield signs and persons with
       disabilities parking area signs at specified locations in the school parking areas with the
       consent of the School District.

       J.      The designation of any intersection m the school parking areas as a stop
       intersection or as a yield intersection.

       K.     The designation of no mobile telephone use areas by motor vehicle operators.

       Section 3: Traffic and Parking Enforcement. The Village hereby agrees to regulate
the motor vehicle parking and traffic in the school parking areas of the School as depicted on
Exhibit B attached hereto, and to enforce any regulations established for such pursuant to this
Agreement.Except as otherwise expressly provided herein, the Village will bear all costs of
enforcement of the regulations contained in this Agreement and the prosecution of any violators,


                                              -2-
and shall retain any and all revenues obtained as a result of the Village's enforcement of the
Village's regulations and ordinances within the school parking areas of the School.

        Section 4:       Posting of Signs and Installation of Signals. The Village shall have the
right to post or install appropriate parking and traffic control signs as specifically preapproved in
writing by the School District, and School District shall pay the cost of such signs and signals
and the cost of installation and maintenance of such signs and signals.

        Section 5: Term. This Agreement shall be effective as of July 1, 2013, and following
the execution by the parties and the recording of this Agreement with the Lake County Recorder
of Deeds, and shall remain in full force and effect for a term of twenty (20) years expiring July 1,
2033, unless cancelled prior thereto by mutual agreement of the parties hereto or by written
notice of one party to the other giving sixty (60) days' notice of said cancellation to the other
party. In accordance with 625 ILCS 5/11-209( c), no traffic or parking regulation shall be
effective or enforceable until three (3) days after this Agreement is duly recorded at the office of
the Lake County Recorder of Deeds.

        Section 6: Notices. All notices required or to be given pursuant to this Agreement shall
be in writing and either delivered personally, or by a nationally recognized overnight courier
service, or mailed by United States ce1tified mail, postage prepaid, addressed to Village and
School District as follows:

Ifto Village:                         Village of Deerfield
                                      Attention: Village Manager
                                      850 Waukegan Road
                                      Deerfield, Illinois 60015

If to School District:                Superintendent
                                      Deerfield School District No. 109
                                      51 7 Deerfield Rd.
                                      Deerfield, Illinois 60018

        Notices shall be deemed effective and properly delivered and received when and if notice
is either personally delivered, delivered by Federal Express or other overnight courier, or three
(3) business days after notice is deposited in the U.S. Mail, by certified mail, return receipt
requested, postage prepaid.

        Either party may change the names and addresses of the persons to whom notices shall be
delivered by written notice to School District or Village as in the manner herein provided for the
service of notice.

                         AGREEMENT FOR REGULATION OF
                       MOTOR VEHICLE TRAFFIC AND PARKING
                         AT KIPLING ELEMENTARY SCHOOL

       THIS AGREEMENTis made and entered into this _ _ day of                         ,2013, by
and between the VILLAGE OF DEERFIELD, an Illinois municipal corporation (hereinafter
the "Village"), and the BOARD OF EDUCATION OF DEERFIELD SCHOOL DISTRICT
NO. 109, Lake County, Illinois (hereinafter referred to as "School District"), as the owner of
Kipling Elementary School.

                                          RECITALS

        WHEREAS, School District is the owner of a· school commonly known as Kipling
Elementary School ("School"), including the parking areas associated therewith, which is located
within the limits of the Village of Deerfield and is legally described on Exhibit A attached
hereto; and,

        WHEREAS, School District represents and warrants that it has the legal right, title and
authority to control, operate, manage and maintain the School and the parking areas associated
therewith and to enter into this agreement; and,

        WHEREAS, School District desires to enter into an agreement with the Village in order
to empower the Village to regulate the parking of motor vehicles and motor vehicle traffic within
the parking areas associated with the SchooL and to enforce motor vehicle parking and traffic
regulations with the parking areas associated with the School pursuant to the provisions of
Section 11-209 of the Illinois Motor Vehicle Code (625 ILCS 5/11-209) and of the Municipal
Code ofthe Village of Deerfield;

       NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants, promises, terms and
conditions contained herein, the parties hereto agree as follows:



                                              -1-
~
I




            Section 1: Incorporation of Recitals. The above and foregoing recitals, being material
    to this Agreement, are hereby incorporated and made a pmi hereto by this reference.

            Section 2: Traffic Regulations. That the Village is hereby authorized and directed to
    establish and enforce motor vehicle parking and traffic control regulations within the parking
    areas associated with the School, including:

           A.     The prohibition, regulation, restriction or limitation of the stopping, standing or
           parking of vehicles in specified portions ofthe school parking areas.

           B.      The designation of fire lanes in the school parking areas (meaning travel lanes for
           firefighting equipment upon which there shall be no standing or parking of any motor
           vehicles at any time so that firefighting equipment can move freely thereon).

           C.     The enforcement of persons with disabilities parking areas where appropriate
           above-ground signs have been posted in compliance with state law.

           D.      The enforcement of stop signs and other traffic control signs that may be located
           in the school parking areas.

           E.      The establishment and regulation of loading zones with the consent of the School
           District.

           F.     The prohibition or regulation of the tuming of vehicles or specified types of
           vehicles at intersections or other designated locations in the parking areas.

           G.     The designation of any separate roadway in the parking areas for one-way traffic
           only with the consent of the School District

           H.      The regulation of a crossing of any roadway m the school parking areas by
           pedestrians.

           I.      The erection of stop signs, flashing signals, yield signs and persons with
           disabilities parking area signs at specified locations in the school parking areas with the
           consent of the School District.

           J.      The designation of any intersection m the school parking areas as a stop
           intersection or as a yield intersection.

           K.     The designation of no mobile telephone use areas by motor vehicle operators.

           Section 3: Traffic and Parking Enforcement. The Village hereby agrees to regulate
    the motor vehicle parking and traffic in the school parking ~reas of the School as depicted on
    Exhibit B attached hereto, and to enforce any regulations established for such pursuant to this
    Agreement.Except as otherwise expressly provided herein, the Village will bear all costs of
    enforcement of the regulations contained in this Agreement and the prosecution of any violators,


                                                  -2-
and shall retain any and all revenues obtained as a result of the Village's enforcement of the
Village's regulations and ordinances within the school parking areas of the School.

        Section 4:       Posting of Signs and Installation of Signals. The Village shall have the
right to post or install appropriate parking and traffic control signs as specifically preapproved in
writing by the School District, and School District shall pay the cost of such signs and signals
and the cost of installation and maintenance of such signs and signals.

        Section 5: Term. This Agreement shall be effective as of July 1, 2013, and following
the execution by the parties and the recording of this Agreement with the Lake County Recorder
of Deeds, and shall remain in full force and effect for a term of twenty (20) years expiring July 1,
2033, unless cancelled prior thereto by mutual agreement of the parties hereto or by written
notice of one party to the other giving sixty (60) days' notice of said cancellation to the other
party. In accordance with 625 ILCS 5/11-209( c), no traffic or parking regulation shall be
effective or enforceable until three (3) days after this Agreement is duly recorded at the office of
the Lake County Recorder of Deeds.

        Section 6: Notices. All notices required or to be given pursuant to this Agreement shall
be in writing and either delivered personally, or by a nationally recognized overnight courier
service, or mailed by United States certified mail, postage prepaid, addressed to Village and
School District as follows:

Ifto Village:                         Village ofDeerfield
                                      Attention: Village Manager
                                      850 Waukegan Road
                                      Deerfield, Illinois 60015

Ifto School District:                 Superintendent
                                      Deerfield School District No. 109
                                      517 Deerfield Rd.
                                      Deerfield, Illinois 60018

        Notices shall be deemed effective and properly delivered and received when and if notice
is either personally delivered, delivered by Federal Express or other overnight courier, or three
(3) business days after notice is deposited in the U.S. Mail, by certified mail, return receipt
requested, postage prepaid.

        Either party may change the names and addresses of the persons to whom notices shall be
delivered by written notice to School District or Village as in the manner herein provided for the
service of notice.

        Section 7:     Severability. Each provision of this Agreement is severable from all
other provisions of this Agreement and, if one or more of the provisions of this Agreement shall
be declared invalid, the remaining provisions of this Agreement shall nevertheless remain in full
force and effect.



                                                -3-
        Section 8: Binding Effect. This Agreement shall be binding upon and inure to the
benefit of the parties hereto and their respective orticers, agents, grantees. successors and
assigns.

        Section 9: Entire Agreement. This provisions set forth herein represent the entire
agreement between the parties and supersede any previous oral or written agreements. No
provision may be modi tied, revised or amended in any respect unless such moditlcation. revision

                         AGREEMENT FOR REGULATION OF
                       MOTOR VEHICLE TRAFFIC AND PARKING
                        AT WILMOT ELEMENTARY SCHOOL

       THIS AGREEMENTis made and entered into this _ _ day of                         ,2013, by
and between the VILLAGE OF DEERFIELD, an Illinois municipal corporation (hereinafter
the "Village"), and the BOARD OF EDUCATION OF DEERFIELD SCHOOL DISTRICT
NO. 109, Lake County, Illinois (hereinafter referred to as "School District"), as the owner of
Wilmot Elementary School.

                                          RECITALS

        WHEREAS, School District is the owner of a school commonly known as Wilmot
Elementary School ("School"), including the parking areas associated therewith, which is located
within the limits of the Village of Deerfield and is legally described on Exhibit A attached
hereto; and,

        WHEREAS, School District represents and warrants that it has the legal right, title and
authority to control, operate, manage and maintain the School and the parking areas associated
therewith and to enter into this agreement; and,

        WHEREAS, School District desires to enter into an agreement with the Village in order
to empower the Village to regulate the parking. of motor vehicles and motor vehicle traffic within
the parking areas associated with the School. and to enforce motor vehicle parking and traffic
regulations with the parking areas associated with the School pursuant to the provisions of
Section 11-209 of the Illinois Motor Vehicle Code (625 ILCS 5/1 1-209) and of the Municipal
Code ofthe Village of Deerfield;

       NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants, promises, terms and
conditions contained herein, the parties hereto agree as follows:



                                               -1-
        Section 1: Incorporation of Recitals. The above and foregoing recitals, being material
to this Agreement, are hereby incorporated and made a part hereto by this reference.

        Section 2: Traffic Regulations. That the Village is hereby authorized and directed to
establish and enforce motor vehicle parking and traffic control regulations within the parking
areas associated with the School, including :

       A.     The prohibition, regulation, restriction or limitation of the stopping, standing or
       parking of vehicles in specified portions of the school parking areas.

       B.      The designation of fire lanes in the school parking areas (meaning travel lanes for
       firefighting equipment upon which there shall be no standing or parking of any motor
       vehicles at any time so that firefighting equipment can move freely thereon).

       C.     The enforcement of persons with disabilities parking areas where appropriate
       above-ground signs have been posted in compliance with state law.

       D.      The enforcement of stop signs and other traffic control signs that may be located
       in the school parking areas.

       E.      The establishment and regulation of loading zones with the consent of the School
       District.

       F.     The prohibition or regulation of the turning of vehicles or specified types of
       vehicles at intersections or other designated locations in the parking areas.

       G.     The designation of any separate roadway in the parking areas for one-way traffic
       only with the consent of the School District.

       H.      The regulation of a crossing of any roadway in the school parking areas by
       pedestrians.

       I.      The erection of stop signs, flashing signals, yield signs and persons with
       disabilities parking area signs at specified locations in the school parking areas with the
       consent of the School District.

       J.      The designation of any intersection m the school parking areas as a stop
       intersection or as a yield intersection.

       K.     The designation of no mobile telephone use areas by motor vehicle operators.

       Section 3: Traffic and Parking Enforcement. The Village hereby agrees to regulate
the motor vehicle parking and traffic in the school parking areas of the School as depicted on
Exhibit B attached hereto, and to enforce any regulations established for such pursuant to this
Agreement.Except as otherwise expressly provided herein, the Village will bear all costs of
enforcement of the regulations contained in this Agreement and the prosecution of any violators,


                                              -2-
and shall retain any and all revenues obtained as a result of the Village's enforcement of the
Village's regulations and ordinances within the school parking areas of the School.

        Section 4:       Posting of Signs and Installation of Signals. The Village shall have the
right to post or install appropriate parking and traffic control signs as specifically preapproved in
writing by the School District, and School District shall pay the cost of such signs and signals
and the cost of installation and maintenance of such signs and signals.

        Section 5: Term. This Agreement shall be effective as of July 1, 2013, and following
the execution by the parties and the recording of this Agreement with the Lake County Recorder
ofDeeds, and shall remain in full force and effect for a term oftwenty (20) years expiring July 1,
2033, unless cancelled prior thereto by mutual agreement of the parties hereto or by written
notice of one party to the other giving sixty (60) days' notice of said cancellation to the other
party. In accordance with 625 ILCS 5/11-209( c), no traffic or parking regulation shall be
effective or enforceable until tlu·ee (3) days after this Agreement is duly recorded at the office of
the Lake County Recorder of Deeds.

        Section 6: Notices. All notices required or to be given pursuant to this Agreement shall
be in writing and either delivered personally, or by a nationally recognized overnight courier
service, or mailed by United States certified mail, postage prepaid, addressed to Village and
School District as follows:

If to Village:                        Village ofDeerfield
                                      Attention: Village Manager
                                      850 Waukegan Road
                                      Deerfield, Illinois 60015

If to School District:                Superintendent
                                      Deerfield School District No. 109
                                      517 Deerfield Rd.
                                      Deerfield, Illinois 60018

        Notices shall be deemed effective and properly delivered and received when and if notice
is either personally delivered, delivered by Federal Express or other overnight courier, or three
(3) business days after notice is deposited in the U.S. Mail, by certified mail, return receipt
requested, postage prepaid.

        Either party may change the names and addresses of the persons to whom notices shall be
delivered by written notice to School District or Village as in the manner herein provided for the
service of notice.

        Section 7:     Severability. Each provision of this Agreement is severable from all
other provisions ofthis Agreement and, if one or more of the provisions of this Agreement shall
be declared invalid, the remaining provisions of this Agreement shall nevertheless remain in full
force and effect.



                                                -3-
        Section 8: Binding Effect. This Agreement shall be binding upon and inure to the
benefit of the parties hereto and their respective officers, agents, grantees, successors and
assigns.

       Section 9: Entire Agreement. This provisions set forth herein represent the entire
agreement between the parties and supersede any previous oral or written agreements. No
provision may be modified, revised or amended in any respect unless such modification, revision
or amendment is in writing and signed by both parties.

       Section lO:Execution of Agreement. The parties do hereby certify and warrant that
this Agreement has been executed by their duly authorized officers and representatives.

        IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties hereto have executed this Agreement by their duly
authorized officers as of the day and year first above written.

                              ORDINANCE NO. ______________

              AN ORDINANCE AMENDING THE ARTICLE 9.03-G OF THE
             ZONING ORDINANCE OF THE VILLAGE OF DEERFIELD TO
                 ESTABLISH THE MAXIMUM ALLOWABLE SIZE OF
                     TEMPORARY BUSINESS GROUND SIGNS

_____________________________________________________________________________

       WHEREAS, the Village Center Development Commission has recommended to the Plan

Commission of the Village of Deerfield that the temporary business sign regulations in Article 9.03-

G of the Zoning Ordinance of the Village of Deerfield should be amended to include a maximum

allowable size for temporary business ground signs; and

       WHEREAS, the Plan Commission of the Village of Deerfield, upon the application of the

Village of Deerfield, held a public hearing on February 28, 2013 to consider a text amendment to

Article 9.03-G of the Zoning Ordinance of the Village of Deerfield to establish a maximum

allowable size for temporary business ground signs, said hearing conforming in all respects, in both

manner and form, with the requirements of the Zoning Ordinance of the Village of Deerfield; and

       WHEREAS, the Plan Commission of the Village of Deerfield, after considering the evidence

and supporting materials presented at said hearing, has submitted its written report and findings of

fact to the Board of Trustees of the Village of Deerfield recommending that the temporary business

sign regulations in Article 9.03-G of the Zoning Ordinance of the Village of Deerfield be amended to

establish a maximum allowable size for temporary business ground signs; and

       WHEREAS, the President and Board of Trustees of the Village of Deerfield concur in the

recommendations of the Village Center Development Commission and the Plan Commission and
have determined that it is the best interests of the Village of Deerfield that the text of the Zoning

Ordinance of the Village of Deerfield be amended as provided herein;

       NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE PRESIDENT AND BOARD OF

TRUSTEES OF THE VILLAGE OF DEERFIELD, LAKE AND COOK COUNTIES, ILLINOIS, in

the exercise of its home rule powers, as follows:

       SECTION 1: That Article 9.03-G ("Temporary Business Signs") of Article 9 ("Signs") of

the Zoning Ordinance of the Village of Deerfield, be and the same is hereby amended add a new

Paragraph 2 ("Maximum Area and Configuration") reading as follows (the addition is indicated by

underscoring):

       9.03-G Temporary Business Signs, calling attention to a special, unique or limited
       activity, service, product or sale of limited duration, as follows:

       1.        Number, Area and Height
                 The permitted number, area, height and construction of temporary business
                 signs shall be determined by the Director of Building and Zoning with
                 consideration given to public safety and the signage reasonably necessary and
                 appropriate for the intended purpose.

       2.        Maximum Area and Configuration
                 In no case shall temporary business ground signs exceed two (2) faces, with a
                 gross surface area not greater than 20 square feet per face, with no length or
                 width dimension greater than 5 linear feet.

       3.        Location
                 Temporary business signs shall be located only on the lot upon which the
                 special sale or activity is to occur. Such signs may be located in any required
                 yard, but shall not extend over any lot line.

       4.        Special Conditions

                 a.     Timing. Temporary business signs shall be erected and maintained
                        for a period not to exceed thirty (3) days, at the expiration of which
                        period the permittee shall immediately remove such temporary sign




                                                   -2-
                b.      Limit on Number of Permits. No more than four (4) permits for
                        temporary signs shall be issued for the same zoning lot in one
                        calendar year.


        SECTION 2: That this Ordinance, and each of its terms, shall be the effective legislative act

of a home rule municipality without regard to whether such Ordinance should: (a) contain terms

contrary to the provisions of current or subsequent non-preemptive state law; or, (b) legislate in a

manner or regarding a matter not delegated to municipalities by state law. It is the intent of the

corporate authorities of the Village of Deerfield that to the extent that the terms of this Ordinance

should be inconsistent with any non-preemptive state law, this Ordinance shall supersede state law in

that regard within its jurisdiction.

        SECTION 3: That this Ordinance shall be in full force and effect from and after its passage,

approval and publication in pamphlet form as provided by law.

        PASSED this _______ day of __________________________, 2013.

        NAYS:

        ABSTAIN:

        APPROVED this ________ day of _______________________, 2013.

                                   REQUEST FOR BOARD ACTION

                                                                                                Agenda Item: 13-52


Subject               Intergovemmental Agreement (IGA) For The Installation and Maintenance of a New
                      Walkway in Jewett Park

Action Requested:     Approval ofiGA

Originated By:        Village Manager's Office

Referred To:          Village President and Board of Trustees

Summary of Background and Reason for Request

As the Board may recall, the amended special use permit issued to the Deerfield Public Library by
Ordinance 0-11-32 for the renovations to the Deerfield Public Library at 920 Waukegan Road requires
employees to park off-site and the installation of a lit walkway connecting the stairs west of the library to
the Park District parking lot for Jewett Park on the south side of Hazel Avenue. Given the requirement for
offsite parking and the need to maintain the lit walkway, the attached intergovernmental agreement
between the Library, Park District and Village was prepared to memorialize the use, construct the walkway
and establish for on-going maintenance and lighting energy costs.

The Library and Park District finalized the walkway's location and coordinated its design and lighting
systems to match and integrate with the other walkways and lights in Jewett Park. Once the design was
completed, the Library included bidding out the installation work as pmi of the construction project for the
Library. The IGA provides that the Village supp01i the construction cost with an $85,000 contribution, the
Library a $25,000 contribution and the Park District contribute maintenance and lighting energy costs
going forward. The Library also had to replace the stairway leading down into Jewett Park for it to be code
compliant and had other costs, including construction oversight, for the new walkway. Both the Library
Board and Park Board have executed the agreement. It is also suggested that the Board consider allocating
future impact fees collected for residential projects (AMLI, etc.) to offset this expense as it is an
improvement that meets the criteria in the impact fee ordinance.

The Village Manager will be available to review this matter and respond to questions from the Mayor and
Board of Trustees.

Reports and Documents Attached:

Ordinance 0-11-32 exhibit depicting walkway location
Copy of Intergovemmental Agreement

Date Referred to Board: June 3, 2013

                                      Action Taken: - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
                        INTERGOVERNMENTAL AGREEMENT
                     FOR THE INSTALLATION AND MAINTENANCE
                       OF A NEW WALKWAY IN JEWETT PARK


       THIS INTERGOVERNMENTAL AGREEMENT ("Agreement") is entered into as of

this _ _ day of _ _ _ _ _ _ _, 2013 (the "Effective Date") by and between the Deerfield

Public Library, a body politic and corporate (the "Library"), the Village of Deerfield, an Illinois

home rule municipal corporation ("Deerfield") and the Deerfield Park District, an Illinois unit of

local government (the "Park District").       Library, Deerfield and Park District are sometimes

referred to collectively herein as the "Parties".

                                             RECITALS

        A.      Library is renovating and expanding the Deerfield Public Library building located

at 920 Waukegan Road (the "New Library").

        B.      Plans for the New Library building include the provision of a new walkway that

will connect the Jewett Park parking lot on Hazel Avenue, through Jewett Park, to a connection

to the walkway and stairway leading the west side of the Library site (the "New Walkway").

        C.      The New Walkway will provide a means of pedestrian, employee and customer

access to the New Library from the Jewett Park parking lot.

        D.      The New Walkway will benefit visitors to Jewett Park and will also provide

improved pedestrian access in the Nmihwest Quadrant of the Village Center District as

envisioned in Deerfield's Comprehensive Plan.

        E.      Park District owns Jewett Park and has agreed to allow the New Walkway to be

installed in Jewett Park, including accompanying light fixtures to illuminate the New Walkway,

and further agrees to assume ownership and maintenance of the New Walkway and



                                             Page 1 of6
accompanying light fixtures following completion and acceptance of the New Walkway and

accompanying light fixtures (collectively, the "Project") as provided in this Agreement.

       F.      Library agrees to prepare the necessary civil engineering and construction design

specifications, installation of the Project subject to Park District's approval of the location,

design and specifications for the New Walkway and accompanying light fixtures.

       G.      Library further agrees to administer the construction contract for the Project in

accordance with the approved location, design and specifications for the New Walkway and

accompanying light fixtures.

       H.       Deerfield agrees to contribute up to Eighty-Five Thousand Dollars ($85,000.00)

of the cost for design and installation of the Project.

       I.      Library agrees to contribute Twenty-Five Thousand Dollars ($25,000.00) of the

cost for design and installation of the Project.

       J.       The Parties desire to set forth in this Agreement the terms and conditions agreed

to by the Parties for the design, construction, financing, ownership and maintenance of the

Project.

       K.       The Pmiies are each units of local government within the meaning of the Illinois

Intergovermnental Cooperation Act (5 ILCS 220/1, et seq.) and are authorized by A1iicle VII,

Section 10 of the Constitution of the State of Illinois to contract or otherwise associate among

themselves in the manner provided in this Agreement.

       L.       The Pmiies have agreed it is in the best interests of the residents of the Village of

Deerfield, the Deerfield Park District and the Deerfield Public Library that the Pmiies enter into

this Agreement for the purposes and objects stated herein.




                                             Page 2 of6
       NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual promises, terms, covenants and

conditions set fmih herein, the Village, Park District and Library agree as follows:

       1.      Incorporation of Recitals. The above and foregoing recitals, being material to this

Agreement, are incorporated and made a part hereof as if fully set forth herein.

       2.      Grant of Use.     The Park District grants to the Library and Village the right to

enter and utilize Park District's prope1iy as reasonably required to construct and install the New

Walkway and accompanying light fixtures connecting the Jewett Park parking lot on Hazel

Avenue, over, through and across Jewett Park, to the walkway and stairway leading to the west

side of the Library site, provided that the location, design and construction specifications of the

Project are first approved by the Executive Director of the Park District, which approval will not

be unreasonably withheld, denied or conditioned.

       3.      Project Design.     The Library shall prepare civil engineering and construction

design specifications for the Project, including reasonably detailed mapping information to

identify the proposed location of the New Walkway and accompanying light fixtures (the

"Project Plans"). The Project Plans shall require that all contractors and materialmen to

guarantee all materials and labor incorporated into Project for a period of one (1) year from

acceptance thereof.

       4.      Approval of Project Plans. The Library shall present the Project Plans to the Park

District for Park District approval.    The Library shall not be authorized to enter onto Park

District prope1iy or to proceed with construction of the Project on Park District prope1iy

including but not limited to Jewett Park prope1iy, prior to receiving written approval from the

Park District's Executive Director of the Project Plans.




                                            Page 3 of6
       5.      New Walkway Construction.        The Library shall adve1iise, award, supervise and

construct the Project, shall schedule such work in cooperation with the Park District to minimize

unnecessary disruption to the use of Jewett Park and the Jewett Park parking lot, and shall cause

the New Walkway and accompanying light fixtures to be constructed and installed in

conformance with the approved Project Plans.

       6.      Village Share of Project Costs. The Library shall be reimbursed by the Village

for up to Eighty Five Thousand ($85,000.00) of the Project design and installation costs when

the Project is completed.

       7.      Library Share of Project Costs. Library is responsible for all Project design and

installation costs, but not to exceed Twenty-Five Thousand ($25,000.00) Dollars.

       8.      Indemnity; Insurance. Library shall defend, protect, indemnify and hold harmless

the Park District, the Village and their officers, agents, and employees from and against any and

all liabilities, claims, damages, penalties, causes of action, costs and expenses (including

reasonable attorney's fees) for any liens or claims for lien, injury to persons or damage to

propeliy to the extent such arises out of, or in connection with a breach of this Agreement or the

design and construction of the Project, excluding however, any claims, actions, losses, damages

or expenses caused wholly or in pati by the acts or omissions of the Park District for which the

Park District may be held liable under the laws of the State of Illinois. Nothing herein shall be

construed as a waiver by the Library, Village or the Park District of any and all privileges and

immunities granted in statute of common law.

       9.      Ownership of New Walkway Improvements. Upon completion of the Project

construction in accordance with the approved Project Plans and delivery of an as-built drawing,

the Park District shall inspect the Project. Upon the Park District's approval, it shall own, operate



                                            Page 4 of6
and accept full responsibility for the New Walkway and accompanying light fixture

improvements, including but not limited to future maintenance, replacement, repair and of the

New Walkway and accompanying light fixture improvements installed in Jewett Park or

elsewhere on Park District Propetiy as part of the Project.

       10.     Governing Law. The laws of the State of Illinois shall govern the interpretation

and enforcement of this Agreement.

        11.     Severability. If any provision or part of this Agreement shall ever be held to be

invalid or unenforceable, such invalidity or unenforceability shall not affect any other provision

or parts of this Agreement not held invalid or unenforceable. Such other provisions or parts

which are not held invalid or unenforceable shall continue in full force and affect, unless deletion

of the provision or other part of the Agreement which is held to be invalid or unenforceable,

renders this Agreement meaningless or grossly inequitable.

        12.    Entire Agreement. This Agreement shall constitute the entire agreement of the

Pmiies and supersedes all prior oral and written representations and agreements relating to the

subject matter of this Agreement.

        13.    Modification of Agreement. This Agreement may only be modified or amended

by a writing signed by the authorized representatives of the Village, Park District and Library.

        14.    Binding Effect.      This Agreement shall be binding upon and shall inure to the

benefit of the respective successors, grantees, heirs and assigns ofthe Parties.

        IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Village of Deerfield, Deerfield Park District and

Deerfield Public Library have hereunto caused this Intergovernmental Agreement to be executed

as of the date and year first above written by their duly authorized officers pursuant to legal

authority granted by their respective corporate authorities under the statutes and laws of the State

                                                                           Agenda Item: 13-58
 Subject:       Approval of Wastewater Reclamation Facility (WRF) Improvement Project
                Change Order No. 20
 Action Requested:     Authorize Change Order No. 20 (Various) for a Credit of $17,983.00
 Originated By: Director of Public Works and Engineering
 Referred To:    Mayor and Board of Trustees

Summary of Background and Reason for Request:

 The change order request has been summarized in the attached letter from Strand Associates,
 including the Change Order No. 20 document. The amount of the contract price adjustment
 requested with Change Order No. 20 is a credit in the amount of $17,983. This compares to
 previously approved change order adjustments in the aggregate amount of $505,645.70 yielding
 an overall increase to the original contract price of $487,662.70 or 1.7 percent (0.017) of the
 original contract value.

 The contractor has requested a 21 day contract completion date extension with this Change Order
 No. 20. The reason for this request is to complete the landscaping. If approved, the new
 completion date will be June 6, 2013.

 Items 20j through 20m are deductions due to the closeout of allowances on the contract that have
 not been fully used and are no longer needed.

 Strand Associates has reviewed all the materials and prices submitted by the contractor. They
 recommend approval of these items as described on the attached documents.

 The Director of Public Works and Engineering recommends that the Mayor and Board of
 Trustees authorize the adjustment to the WRF construction contract price for the items described,
 in the credit amount of $17,983 decreasing the total contract amount from the current value of
 $29,955,645.70 to $29,937,662.70.

Also included in this Change Order is a 21 -day extension of the completion dates for the project.
The Contractor has requested a 21-day extension to account for delays in completing land scaping
because of the unseasonab ly cold and wet weather this spring. We agree with the Contractor that
these delays were outside of its control and unforeseeable, and that the extension is justified. The
new Final Completion dates is June 6, 20 13.
